website_summaries.verdict: The Arlo Pro is an even smarter DIY cam than Netgear's first-gen Arlo, but competitors are closing in fast with innovative designs and updated apps.
pros: Netgear's $250/£300 Arlo Pro provides indoor and outdoor security monitoring in a single camera
You get seven days of free event-based cloud storage, and its rechargeable battery is supposed to last for up to six months
cons: The Arlo Pro costs more than its competition, and it was difficult to see what was happening in night-vision mode
Some customers won't want to deal with a hub accessory during installation

customer_reviews.title: Useless. doesn't record in emergencies
customer_reviews.text: Goes off when a car drives by but didn't catch a burglar going into the front door. Today someone drove up to the property and it wouldn't let me record. Missed their license plate. These cameras might cost me my life one day.
customer_reviews.author: Mozilly

customer_reviews.title: Camera quality is crap doesn't work as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: This camera isn't going to do anything for you. It will catch countless cars driving by once their out of the frame, the mail man, maybe a passerby or two. Here's a picture of it not working when it captured video of the guy stealing my propane tank. Thanks for NOTHING arlo.
customer_reviews.author: sean ashby

customer_reviews.title: Not weatherproof
customer_reviews.text: These are not weatherproof as described. They will not work in very cold temperatures. According to the specs they will work to -4 degrees F. In my experience they quit working right about 0-8 degrees F.
customer_reviews.author: matt

customer_reviews.title: Can't even read a license plate 10ft away in broad daylight
customer_reviews.text: Can't even read a license plate 10ft away in broad daylight on highest quality setting. 1 WEEK UPDATE: One of the cameras keeps dying within 1 day, it's either a faulty camera or battery. I've charged it fully twice and this camera location has almost no activity. 4 WEEK UPDATE: One camera still dying, doesn't even stay online for a day. Other 5 cameras have been fine but had to lower sensitivity on one because it was killing battery about every week by being triggered too easily. Video very grainy compared to any mid-tier wired security system such as those you'd see in Costco.
customer_reviews.author: Good Bye 123456789

customer_reviews.title: The worst security camera I've owned
customer_reviews.text: We bought this system 2 months ago and just installed last week and unfortunately this product doesn't work as advertised. The feed suffers extreme delays and rendering the live features useless. The app constantly freezes or is just unresponsive. I have had people come to my front door and leave before the app would even open. Its so useless and auch a waste of money!!!
customer_reviews.author: natasha

customer_reviews.title: Horrible customer service and Terrible technicians
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't get this device set up because the Base unit had been used. The serial number was already registered to a different email and user. When I called netgear, nothing was resolved after 1 1/2 hrs with them. They couldn't figure it themselves and told me that I would get a call back which I never did. Horrible customer service and Terrible technicians. The mounting is easy to take off as well. It holds the camera by magnet. If the customer service was decent, I would consider troubleshooting bit the response and knowledge of these guys is not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: How Bad Is This Product
customer_reviews.text: How Bad Is This Product? - Let me count the ways (1) battery life is approx. 1 week. You now have a new chore in your life (2) one camera quit working/charging 30 days after purchase (3) offshore customer service required multiple calls multiple emails multiple troubleshooting efforts.Did I mention multiple. (4) finally OK we admit this product broke 30 days after purchse so YOU get to pay to send it back for an exchange. DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.author: John L

customer_reviews.title: Changed reciew after 5months. Dont buy this.product
customer_reviews.text: +'s 1. Darn easy to setup and install. 2. Easy, pretty intuitive UI. We can quick change the settings using a smarphone. -'s: 1. Enough of a lag that we can miss events, that's the whole point of installing these things. 2. Cannot make out anything in the night even within 10-15 feet. 3. Video quality during daylight is not detail enough to make out the facial features from even 10-15 feet. Review after 5 months of use. 4. Because of the number of events we completely miss I DO NOT recommend this at all.
customer_reviews.author: John D

customer_reviews.title: I like it
customer_reviews.text: I bought Arlo Pro and had some issues with the batteries and was unable to fix it so I returned it and received another one. It works great. Picture quality is great. You do have to learn proper placement and fine tune the sensitivity but I have no issues with this camera. One issue is the battery will not charge if it gets too cold and that can be a real problem. Mine are plugged in so I dont have to worry about that.
customer_reviews.author: MT

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT PURCHASE!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this and an Arlo Pro 2 for my moms house. They claim to have free 7 day monitoring but after we changed our internet service they now want us to pay $99 a year for subscription. Complete bait and swich not to mention HORRENDOUS customer from Nick (N4578J) the supposed supervisor in what he claimed was the NJ office.... though I'm willing to bet it's probably a call center in India. What a horrible brand. I still have this one unopened. I will try to return but am outside of the return date. What a nightmare. Beware of Arlo... Stay away.
customer_reviews.author: jyrock

customer_reviews.title: This wireless system does not work!
customer_reviews.text: This product is terrible if you want to use it outside and if you have any walls!! This sounds funny, but it is just what the Netgear rep said to us when we complained about the product not working after a full day off from work trying to set it up-three pretty smart people. What I can recommend is to read the "real" product reivews online about having to constantly re-sync the cameras, how open spaces are needed with good lighting for decent results and how "weatherproof" really means weather resistant. I am a netgear fan, but this product is awful. I have heard the wired product is better. Do not spend money on this product!
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Allen

customer_reviews.title: Total Rip Off
customer_reviews.text: I spent over $1,000 for my arlo set and within less than a year the batteries have gone to crap- i am having to recharge 3 times as much and the cameras are actually recording less (makes no sense), the company had a massive information hack and VERY minimally advised their customers- i noticed my camera was recording when i had them turned off, the company has yet to respond to several requests i’ve made in regards. This is a product meant to provide extra security but instead has violated privacy and the company could care less- ARLO IS GREEDY, i could never recommend their product.
customer_reviews.author: Jane Smith

customer_reviews.title: Look elsewhere for CCTV solutions
customer_reviews.text: While this product might be highly rated, my experience was otherwise. The image is NOT HD. The zoom feature exaggerates the blurry image. NetGear tech support was basically useless. We had agreed that the camera was defective and an RMA would be issued within 24-48 hours. A second session was a repeat of the first, again, no RMA issued. I’m returning for full credit and looking elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: PODIII

customer_reviews.title: Shot battery life.
customer_reviews.text: The picture quality is great. My largest complaints are the difficulty picking up sound and short battery life. In rooms where there is constant movement through the day the batteries need to be recharged every three days. I’m rooms with minimal movement the batteries need to be recharged every 5 days. The charger that came with the cameras gives me an error message when I plug it in as if I’m using a third party charger. The sound quality is not great. The cameras are mounted up high and I can not hear conversations well at all. The picture quality is okay and I like the storage options.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: False advertisement - Crap batteries
customer_reviews.text: I hate giving bad reviews but this one I had to let the other buyers know. I've purchased this camera as I've noticed that there's a lot of good reviews. I am not sure if my batteries are just faulty or defective. I've installed all 6 camera's all over the house just to test it. Not even a week and my batteries are down to 45 percent... Really!! Wow, I thought these batteries last up to 6 months? Audio is not that great either. Update: 10/24/2018 After a week one battery completely drained to 0%. This doesn't look good. I will wait for another week and see how the rest will hang on.
customer_reviews.author: Dr0pZ0n3

customer_reviews.title: Perfect and works well with iPhone.
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical to purchase such an expensive system that did not support Apple HomeKit, but after a months worth of use I love this system. It gives extremely fast updates for movement and audio. At first the audio was very sensitive and gave too many notifications, but after adjusting the sensitivity it’s perfect. I keep this system armed at all times, with no automatic audible alarm, and push notifications only. This has worked well for me and allows me to be aware of who’s at the door, when packages arrive, and provides a comforting sense of security. Despite not being compatible with HomeKit, this system is perfect. I would recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: MathiasR

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY.
customer_reviews.text: I really liked these cameras for quality and the app but these refurbished units both quit working within a few months. One only works when it’s plugged in to the charger shuts off when unplugged and the other one just doesn’t turn on at all anymore. We had them both hung under awnings so they aren’t water damaged and it has not been unreasonable temps in Tennessee since we bought these. Return policy is 15 days and after that they offer ZERO help with any issues. These are not a cheap purchase for something that will only last you 3 months. Buy new from the actual company—these people are awful. Customer service with them is crap.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Buy
customer_reviews.text: This is the first Amazon review I have been compelled to submit. We bought two Arlo cameras. One camera works fine. After a few weeks, the second camera stopped working. It drained the battery very quickly. We tried all the troubleshooting options, the problem continued. Dealing with Arlo customer service has been a nightmare - significant time on the phone, with very little help. We finally got the option to send the camera back and receive a replacement. Of course, we have to pay $16.90 for shipping. We bought these cameras because they were supposed to be easy to use. That has not been the case.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Beware!  The website to review your video still relies on Adobe Flash!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this because it got such good reviews on multiple sites, and offered 7 days of free online storage. I was quite disappointed to learn when I got it that the website requires Adobe Flash. I was quite surprised to find that out, and wish I had known earlier. In this day and age, it is quite surprising that a company as savvy as Netgear is relying on Flash. If and when they every update their website, I will return to update my review. Until then, I recommend avoiding this product unless you can tolerate Flash.
customer_reviews.author: MDamazonFan

customer_reviews.title: This product is a scam
customer_reviews.text: They say batteries last up to 6 months. It takes one month to drain the batteries and with 13 sec recordings weekly. If they didn't say anything about the battery life I would guess it that it would last around one month, since Netgear is not a great consumer oriented company. off course they don't built products to last. Also, sometimes it picks up the motion and sometimes it doesn't. it is way late to record motions, when I check the recordings sometimes I see a car leaving by just its bumper. I am very upset with this company and never ever buy their security camera products
customer_reviews.author: T. Sen

customer_reviews.title: Please don't get fooled by the positive reviews
customer_reviews.text: I've used this for three weeks. This may be good as an indoor camera, again if you don't care about clarity. Video clarity (even with the best) is horrible if you are placing under sunlight or in night vision mode. For example., you can see a man in red jacket, or black shirt moving. that's it. You won't be able to figure out faces or details. If deterrence is your purpose, place a fake camera. I've not used enough to comment on the battery life. Please don't get fooled by the positive reviews (PAID?).
customer_reviews.author: RRM

customer_reviews.title: Nice Product. Dependability a problem.
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty neat system and is easy to set up and use. Problem is in customer support. After three months one of the cameras is dropping off line and all they can do is tell me to swap the batteries around and wait to see if it fails again. If the battery works fine in another camera it should be providing power just fine. The camera is the problem. Does not make since to them though. They would prefer to hope the problem just goes away somehow and take care of itself. Not the type of response you would expect for someone providing a "Pro Security Camera".
customer_reviews.author: EddyT

customer_reviews.title: Bait & Switch (Probably a warehouse mistake)
customer_reviews.text: This camera is falsely advertised!!!! If you order this camera expecting the Arlo Pro 2 1080p version (Model #VMC4030P) as advertised, you will receive the cheaper, older model Arlo Pro 720p version (Model #VMC4030) I have had multiple phone calls with amazon customer service to straighten this issue out and we came to a satisfactory resolution - but be aware, this particular item is improperly labeled as 1080p when it is not. As for Arlo Pro 2 cameras - they are great, I love them and I am buying more to add to my network!
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Charger problems
customer_reviews.text: Looks like "Arlo" but arrived in very basic wrapping with the wrong cable to charge it. It plugged in fine but kept sending a notice that charger was not compatible. Then it would not completely charge on a cable that came with my other Arlo cameras. I should have sent it back but was leaving on a trip. It charges but not completely. It was a few dollars cheeper but appears to be a lower quality. Not sure if it's a knock off but my other cameras are better night vision and charge with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Arlo pro works great
customer_reviews.text: Arlo pro batteries seem to last a lot longer time do you original arlo
customer_reviews.author: Joseph puleo

customer_reviews.title: Software sucks
customer_reviews.text: The hardware work fine. The app sucks!!!! We use 3 different devices to access Arlo: Iphone 7, Moto 4x and a brand new Lenovo Tablet. The Iphone can't always turn the system on or off, Moto works fine, the Tablet does not receive any notifications. Arlo will not help. When they update the app, you loose all your settings, and they disable the alarm. NOW we get Ads, every time I open the app, EVERY TIME, we get push notification, that at 1st look like an Alarm went off. Buy something else, There is NO customer support.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Mandatory Two-Step Authentication
customer_reviews.text: Read the reviews on Mandatory Two-Step Authentication on the ARLO forum before you purchase. A lot of very disappointed customers. Arlo is implementing two-step authentication the end of September, 2020. The cameras are very good, but they are a bit slow to respond on mobile devices, PC or Alexa. The new two-step will only further delay access to viewing cameras. This is very critical when something goes down and you need immediate access. The two-step should be an option, not mandatory. Arlo says you only have to do it once. That is not an accurate statement.
customer_reviews.author: YaquinaHead

customer_reviews.title: easily offline for hours or days. very frustrating
customer_reviews.text: I bought two 6-camera-set for my two homes. Whenever slightly more activities, the camera will be offline, sometimes for days, sometimes have to reset by pulling battery out. very frustrating experiences. I hope they can fix the offline issues, then I would give 4 or 5 stars. Camera offline often, customer support is really bad!!!
customer_reviews.author: amazon-faithful

customer_reviews.title: USELESS
customer_reviews.text: Didn't work right out of the box, customer service was less than useless, I had to set this up fast as were going to be out of the home for 5 days while my husband had surgery. So they suggested I buy an other one from Amazon and return the dysfunctional one and the two items would cross paths, meanwhile I'm out a ton of money and a change that the product is still less than useless! Don't waste your money, I should have listened to the reviews better.
customer_reviews.author: Zoe Hoffman

customer_reviews.title: Battery life sucks after 1 year customer service sucks
customer_reviews.text: Bought these and used for just a year. Battery life has completely depleted. Batteries will not work for more than 1 WEEK!! Do not buy! Arlo came back to me saying I need to configure to lowest settings to have it last. AFTER PAYING A PRETTY PENNY FOR THIS AND I HAVE TO CONFIGURE TO THE LOWEST SETTING?!? AND AFTER 1 YEAR MY BATTERY LIFE CANNOT LAST FOR A WEEK?!? No do not buy. Netgears quality has dropped Update: 3/27/2020 Arlo apps now come with advertisements! Sweet after I pay $300-$400 for this camera set I am not being forced to view advertisements.
customer_reviews.author: t

customer_reviews.title: Ehhh
customer_reviews.text: 1. Well first the battery worked for about 2 weeks befored needing to be charged Now the battery needs to be charged every 3 days as one day with 10 clips drains the battery 25-30% 2. The arlo camera does not record a lot of footage it will catch some occasionally coming up to the door and never leaving 3. You cannot view your usb storage of videos unless you disconnect the USB drive and connect it to a computer, which ruins the whole point of a wireless and remote monitoring 4. There is no warning of when your arlo is disconnected or powered off that alerts or logs for security
customer_reviews.author: GENE

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the hassle
customer_reviews.text: What a headache. Two of the four cameras in my system have been replaced as "defective" by the manufacturer, but getting any semblance of help out of Arlo/Netgear customer service is beyond ridiculous. The camera's quality and features are nice, but the reliability and support just isn't there to back up the product. There's no peace of mind when you go to check on the security of your home and see "IT'S TIME TO CHARGE YOUR BATTERY" on a camera that has less than a day of use from being fully charged.
customer_reviews.author: D. E.

customer_reviews.title: Does Not Get the Job Done
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like this so badly. The hardware is well built and sleek looking. However, the bottom line is that it's functionality is so limited and unreliable that it simply fails to fulfill it's purpose. The connectivity to the camera through the app is sluggish and spotty. The app crashes a lot, too - read the reviews for the app. Because the smartphone based app does not work well, it doesn't matter if the picture and sound quality is good. It doesn't matter how many features there are. This just doesn't get the job done, and the app/software does the cool design a huge disservice. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: Great but with a few bugs
customer_reviews.text: The Arlo system is very convenient as far as installation is concerned. However, I am noticing that my camera doesn't always record when it should and when it does, it records in 15 second increments. Sometimes the recording doesn't begin until the subject is almost out of the frame. I worry that if someone were to steal packages from my porch, that the recording won't kick off in time. I hope that Arlo releases a software update soon. To Arlo, please release an update extending the record time or to record when all motion has stopped. I did enable the setting to record until motion has stopped - but it doesn't work how it should.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: Just doesn’t last
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this for about a year and a half. Worked great and had it outside our house and maybe had to charge it 5 times over that whole period.. but now it’s not lasting more than a few weeks and just won’t work or charge now. Tried resetting everything per online troubleshooting. Too expensive for this level of reliability... $50 to roll the dice that a new battery will solve the problem is too much. Have Arlo system with the CR123 batteries too but don’t recommend. Replacement batteries are expensive and don’t last.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Ryan

customer_reviews.title: BUYER BEWARE!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased camera's in 2018. Product support none existent to terrible. Weekly problems usually caused by the company's system. Support is terrible to none existent. Techs are polite but cannot resolve most problems, which are not due to camera but companies technological blunders. Hours wasted on phone, chat, and setting resetting cameras and base station when problem is on company end. Check out their community support pages. Latest app upgrade caused cellphones to be unable to see videos/use cameras.Several days into problem, no fix no info from company. Don't purchase. Get a different system.
customer_reviews.author: Gary McDowall

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: I've been searching for home surveillance systems over the last six months and have struggled between several different brands. Netgear's Arlo Pros are almost perfect. I love the fact that I'm not bound by wires and they are weather proof.. I love the fact that I can set IFTTT programming for individual cameras. The resolution is incredible and mobile app fairly easy to navigate. The only gripe I have is that the two way volume (specifically being able to talk through a mobile device or computer) is terrible. I can hear what's going on at my home perfectly but have great difficulty communicating back. If Netgear could duplicate that of the Nestcam, I would. be thrilled.
customer_reviews.author: Dusty Harris

customer_reviews.title: BATTERY LIFE TOO SHORT -- DON'T BUY IT!
customer_reviews.text: The battery charge is too short! We placed the cameras in locations that are high and out of reach. However, having to take out the heavy extension ladder to reach the cameras to recharge the batteries is VERY INCONVENIENT. Placing the cameras any lower kind of defeats the purpose of security if the bad guy can reach up and grab the camera. No Bueno. I do NOT recommend this product. Be sure to ask about the length of time the charge holds. We have to recharge ours every month. No Bueno.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cameras are cool, support is terrible.
customer_reviews.text: I loved the cameras. I bought this to accompany my other two cameras. Then one stopped working, and I'm trying to deal with their support. OH MY GOD. It's a friggin' nightmare. HOURS on hold. Hour on a chat, with 5-10 minutes between responses when you finally get connected. After waiting an hour on hold, I was told I'd been sent to the wrong group, and it was going to be another hour, so someone would call me back. Nothing but crickets for days since... It's absolutely miserable. And now it looks like the second camera may be having the same issue. This is a nightmare. Worst support experience I've ever had.
customer_reviews.author: Zed

customer_reviews.title: BEFORE YOU BUY!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: At first it worked GREAT and even helped police on a car break in case but now a little over a year and the out door camera started to white out. I have reset it multiple time which work for about 2 weeks then starts doing it again. Also noticed it stopped recording after midnight at different times (no schedule set and not consistent) sometimes record all the way through other times not no day specific just random. Started with a high and ended up with the police knocking on my door to ask if I caught anything and had to tell them sorry camera is just for show now. Wont even charge now. Absolutely disappointing
customer_reviews.author: Cristina C.

customer_reviews.title: Returned
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for Black Friday as part of a 4 pack for $499, and although they took closer to 8 days, not the 2 as advertised, the cameras were very disappointing. There was a 21 second delay from movement being detected to when I was able to view “live”. The perp would be long gone by then! Also, there was no way of being notified when certain areas had movement... for example, my old cameras would allow only my driveway to notify me, but not every car driving by. I would stop checking the notifications if I got a message every time a cat walked by.
customer_reviews.author: angela g

customer_reviews.title: Get a protection plan. Batteries will not charge after a year of use.
customer_reviews.text: Cost of setting up and running our own cameras was worth the time and effort. For the price for this bundle during cyber Monday 2017, the picture & sound quality is decent enough. Installation is easy. However, the battery life is not good. Pony up for the 4-year protection plan. We have only had 3 of the cameras in use on the outside of our farmhouse during renovations over the last year and were rotating the batteries as needed. Two of the batteries are now completely dead and will not charge. It will cost $100 to replace them - cursing myself for not going with a the protection plan as I usually do on electronics purchases over $100.
customer_reviews.author: Betch Green

customer_reviews.title: quit charging after 5 months
customer_reviews.text: 5 months in and it won't charge. Still works because I ordered a longer wire and it is plugged in all the time, but for the price point, I had hoped I'd get more than 5 months of 100% functionality
customer_reviews.author: tim

customer_reviews.title: The ARLO App is poorly designed and totally incompatable with various devices and internet Browsers
customer_reviews.text: The operating system of the ARLO camera security system has been seriously compromised with the latest APP update. Much of the camera functions do not work properly if at all, and the system is basically unreliable as a security system. I suggest you check out the ARLO Community Forum Website before purchasing this product. Further, the customer service support center is located outside the USA, and although I have found them very polite, they are pretty much useless, as they are simply call takers. Buyer beware!
customer_reviews.author: Al Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Poor battery
customer_reviews.text: Battery supplied went bad after 45days of use,for replacement cost of the odd shaped battery ,I for one can't pay 50.00 every 45 days for a new battery,initial setup was easy,product worked well up until the battery wouldn't charge more than 56%and depleted quickly
customer_reviews.author: Karen Osborne

customer_reviews.title: Becomes defective soon after warranty
customer_reviews.text: Purchased April 2017. One camera died before its 2 year anniversary. What broke is the charger inside. It will not charge the battery anymore. I'm using the second camera to charge the battery. Funny thing, the iphone software knew about the charge issue and told me to read a knowledge page. This is an expensive system. To not get more than 2 years out of it is disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Very good system with some app issues
customer_reviews.text: The cameras provide good views but it is clear that this is 720p with regards to detail and clarity. However, the night vision is excellent. The app firmware has issues at times when viewing live because sometimes it won't allow you to view at all and so one has to try clicking on live view again or exiting the app and try again. I chose this system not just because how easy it was to set up, but mostly because of the free basic cloud subscription. It's overall a better choice for me than Nest. I'm very pleased with this system, but the app has some reliability issues that need to be worked out by Netgear.
customer_reviews.author: TommyT

customer_reviews.title: Camera is useless without a well-functioning app
customer_reviews.text: Arlo recently shut down the previous app for a new one. Since that time, the cameras are basically useless. The app is required to access recorded videos and see live camera action. The new app is worthless and the manufacturer seems to be doing nothing about it. After working near flawlessly for a year (old app), the new app shows only 13 seconds of recording, despite there being activity right in front of the camera. I am also regularly unable to view recordings when I want to...they appear only after hours delay. DO NOT PURCHASE ARLO CAMERAS UNTIL THEY FIX THEIR APP.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good camera
customer_reviews.text: Needed another camera with no light to add to my home security already had 3 Ring spot/flood lights and one Ring door bell. Advantages over Ring: 1) Better app 2) Can control state (armed/disarmed) with SmartThings/Alexa 3) Can control recording separate form notifications 4) Triggered by motion and/or sound 5) Limited cloud storage with no subscription 6) Local storage to memory stick Disadvantages compared to Ring 1) Slower network response when viewing 2) Ring has much better video resolution/quality 3) No motion zones
customer_reviews.author: lakerunr

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this lagging piece of junk.
customer_reviews.text: What a piece of junk! Even with the camera just a couple of feet away from the base station, in the same room with an unobstructed view, the video and sound lag so bad that the image is several minutes old. There is no way that you are going to be able to use the two way audio to communicate with anybody. It is junk unless you are interested in seeing what happened in the past. The quality degrades even more when you place the camera in a different room. Much further away than that results in a lost connection. Do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: Disgruntled

customer_reviews.title: Impressed
customer_reviews.text: I've had an Arlo camera installed for about a week now outside just above my garage door. I must say I am impressed by how easy it was to setup and install. The battery is still at 97% even though it has recorded several videos in my driveway when someone walks by it. The only thing I would improve is the app for viewing videos. I have not found a way to select multiple videos to delete at the same time. It is likely possible and I have not found it yet. This is minor though. I recommend this camera system to anyone that wants a pain free experience setting up a security camera.
customer_reviews.author: J. Wood

customer_reviews.title: Flakey.  Arlo web page is down 3+ months cameras useless.
customer_reviews.text: Arlo and Netgear are now two seperate companies Arlo did a firmware upgrade and broke it. I can't log on any longer. I have two cameras + base. Its totally useless now. Customer support in now non existence. Arlo and Netgear are now two seperate companies. Hosed everything.
customer_reviews.author: mk

customer_reviews.title: Not Reliable
customer_reviews.text: If anything is in it's view, such as cars in the driveway, it's very unreliable at picking up movement. I've had instances where it won't record someone standing at my front door. At times will it record someone walking up my walkway but won't record the same person leaving and vice versa. If someone is moving at a fast walk, it won't pick up that person at all. It may pick-up a home invasion if the perpetrators stand in front of the camera and discuss it first but I wouldn't trust it to pick-up a threat in real-time. It has a serious lag issue that makes this camera just like having a fake ADT sign in your yard.
customer_reviews.author: SCbuckeye12

customer_reviews.title: IT WILL DRIVE YOU CRAZY, And if you return cost you $50 or more to restock??
customer_reviews.text: Never worked right now lights are on but NO ONE IS HOME! WASTE OF MORE TIME THEN WORTH. Now Amazon has kept $50+ to restock a DEFECTIVE unit! B.S.! Plus I bought extra mounts $10 and 2 skins for the cameras that stopped working. This is what I get for listening to my neighbors, Gotta have a camera to watch for the bad guys! I had one good video of a Buck eating the birds food! That was one Expensive Black n White 1 min. movie! Live and learn. Be Careful what kind of Security you buy. A Doberman was my first Choice.
customer_reviews.author: ret.Pet Pro

customer_reviews.title: Won’t recharge
customer_reviews.text: These cameras are junk, it won’t charge properly I have to stand there and jiggle the cord to get it to charge. It’s keeps giving a charging error and to go to some article about it but there’s no way to figure where the article is or how to troubleshoot. They disconnect from the base station randomly and the motion detection is inconsistent
customer_reviews.author: Mark Mollenkopf

customer_reviews.title: Battery Drains in 3 Days
customer_reviews.text: BUYER BEWARE! I have owned Arlo Pro since 2015. They've been working well until a few days ago. I charged both batteries to 100%. Not sure why but this week the battery started to drain ridiculously fast. Within 3 days both cameras went from 100% to 4%. This is without any recording. I'm on the phone with them and the customer service is truly bad. Waited 20 minutes and finally talked to a live person who asked me if I swapped the locations or batteries, which doesn't make any sense because both batteries are draining. I finally asked to speak to a supervisor - it's been 40 minutes and so far nothing... Don't waste your money on Arlo.
customer_reviews.author: EV EV

customer_reviews.title: Very poor range on motion detection
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this system to notify me when people are on my property who do not belong there. The motion detection sensitivity is all the way up, yet, the device only turns on when an object is within 10 feet of the camera. There is no protection for the rest of my property. Someone could break into my vehicle parked 20 feet away from the camera, and Arlo wouldn't record a thing. Total waste of money. I did verify that I didn't have the motion sensitivity on backwards. It is not a user error. The only thing Arlo can protect is your front porch from stray cats. Do not buy!
customer_reviews.author: Twelve Drummers Drumming

customer_reviews.title: Low Battery Life
customer_reviews.text: Great security camera, but get ready to drop some $$$ on this system. One of the major downfall of this wireless security camera set is its battery life. If you don't buy the only available replacement batteries for this ($50 each) then you would find yourself replacing each camera every other week, which is not only a major inconvenience but also a question of reliability since you can't monitor the house as you would like if you need to take it down so often to recharge the batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick F

customer_reviews.title: Offline- then you have to remove the camera and resync
customer_reviews.text: I have several Arlo Pro and Pro 2 cameras. When they work, they are wonderful. After power outage, some of the cameras go offline. The only wayt to bring them back to life is to remove them from app and resync. The cutomer support is waste of time. They dont understand problem. Even if they do, they lie. My basestation records the footage from camera even though the app is showing the camera as offline. Customer support want me to unmount the camera from top of my roof, bring them back down to resync. What a pain. I am switching to some more reliable brand.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron J.

customer_reviews.title: Reliability issues
customer_reviews.text: I purchased an Arlo Pro 2 system with 2 cameras. I was impressed with the clarity (picture quality A+) so I added another camera immediately. It's been about three months now & I'm having to resync at least two or three of them several times a week. When your wheelchair bound & live alone it's a constant battle. I always have at least one or two of them down waiting on a someone for assistance because I am unable to reach them. Security & dependabilty are the main reason that I purchased an Arlo system. Sorry but I'm simply not impressed with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Gregg

customer_reviews.title: Too much money for security aggravations i. e. ...
customer_reviews.text: Too much money for security aggravations i.e.on memorial day there was a global blackout (you can google this and see), leaving many of us without the security protection most of the day that we paid for. Also defective batteries on arrival that was resolved but inconvenient. Problems with cables ordered from Amazon (that were stated to be compatible) that initially worked for a few months and now error messages that have shut it down and has to be replaced. Lastly, problem with one of my cameras that I'm waiting for a replacement. You get the message.
customer_reviews.author: irie

customer_reviews.title: Terrible product support - RMA process does not work
customer_reviews.text: I have a faulty outdoor cable, try to reach product support back in August 2018, after 6 months I gave up and bought a new one, their RMA process failed for me. Then in April 2019 I initiated another RMA, the RMA is approved but as of today (June 2019) I have not received the replacement camera. The RMA is still "stuck" in their website.
customer_reviews.author: Oscar Calvo

customer_reviews.title: So So Camera System.
customer_reviews.text: Not good camera system. too expensive too. I bought Arlo and Arlo Pro system this year and I still have problem with this system. I already sent back 2 camera from my pro to get replaced and 2 from my Arlo system too. I have my camera outside and I think the weather makes these camera stop working well. The camera that I have inside the house work well, I never have problem with those. Outside camera charger cable gets corrosion due to rain and stop charging the battery. camera keep saying incomparable charger cable. I am thinking to replace this camera system for a better brand in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Jorge R. Salazar

customer_reviews.title: Terrible customer support from Arlo
customer_reviews.text: They are horrible to deal with to get with any support. I tried to signup for the subscription and got hung 3 times then they would not connect me to someone that spoke clear english the call center is india. SO if you have an emergency you cannot get support beware do not buy Arlo.
customer_reviews.author: faith fairbrother

customer_reviews.title: New app has destroyed a previously great product
customer_reviews.text: App v2.6.0 (releases October 2018) has made this system far less useful and far harder to rely on as a security product. Far harder now to review battery, connection and movement information across multiple cameras now meaning it’s harder to monitor your system, ensure your batteries are charged etc. The button to talk through the microphone now gives much less visual information that you are connected - important, as these work like a two way radio and you need to know a connection has been made before you can start talking. The hardware is still great but the new app update has made the system far less useful. I cannot now recommend this product until the software is fixed
customer_reviews.author: MR M W JENKINS

customer_reviews.title: Crappy Customer Support
customer_reviews.text: The mount does not fit on the wall correctly. On the mount there is a spot where the head of the nail is designed to fit into. You put the nail into the wall, and then you put the mount onto the nail. Well the mount won’t grip the nail. Called customer support with Arlo. They refused to help me, and told me to buy a new mount. Kept asking me to send them videos. I requested to have my case escalated. No one even contacted me. I’ve already returned it! No thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Falon

customer_reviews.title: not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Purchased in 2018, I can't count how many times it sent a notice that motion was detected, but nothing recorded, then up to 10 mins to get a camera up to see what ever set it off. And if something is setting off camera(s) repeatedly, forget about getting to see it on your phone. I've had $300 systems do a better job. Arlo is way overpriced.
customer_reviews.author: rob

customer_reviews.title: It's ok. Should come with protective waterproof cover
customer_reviews.text: I have 720 which is adequate but will go 1080 from now on. The base always works. When offline, it's always easy quick to get up and running again Delay in audio video is bad even if cam, base & strong WiFi are right next to u. 720p ok but no 1080. Angle view too narrow. Goes off inline constantly but still 1 of best ranges I've found after trying 5 brands. Wireless Cams WITH Base is the way to go. Siren function: loud, excellent, useful.
customer_reviews.author: Jay B.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent camera quality
customer_reviews.text: The camera quality day/night is wonderful on these. There is only about a 1-2 second delay from when someone goes in front of the camera to when it notifies you on your phone. The reach these have for motion detection is impressive, but beware, it’s sensitive. The cameras kept picking up my neighbors across the street when they would pull in their drive. I just had to adjust the sensitivity and set it lower to fix that problem. My wife loves these as well. She now gets to see how many stray cats wander by our house every night.
customer_reviews.author: Jon and Colleen

customer_reviews.title: Must have for home security
customer_reviews.text: I have used wired camera systems in my not so distant past, but for a wireless system, this is great. Yes, the display is on a slight delay when on motion, but that is to be expected. I am very happy with my Arlo Pro 5 camera system.,and recommend for a home system where your house is not right on top of the road. and motion won't get triggered every time a vehicle passes. Very easy to set up and program into my desktop computer and my and my wife's cell phones. I did upgrade my router from the basic cable router to a Netgear 1900 to be sure I had enough wifi speed.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working in couple of battery discharges
customer_reviews.text: The total useless piece, over priced for what it offers.
customer_reviews.author: S. J.

customer_reviews.title: The arlo service is terrible - tried chat and got into incessantly long hold
customer_reviews.text: After recharging low battery, couldn't get camera to work. Tried everything - last resort was remove device from arlo application then tried resync camera to base - did not work! The arlo service is terrible - tried chat and got into incessantly long hold, tried phone and they said 30 minutes wait time to talk to someone. When I looked at the arlo forum for this same problem I saw many people having the same problem and nothing they tried worked. Why hasn't this been taken care of by now? This is my HOME SECURITY and I don't like someone considering this unimportant! My security is at risk and this system is useless. I would like some immediate help.
customer_reviews.author: Terry V Jones

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!! We bought, set it ...
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY!! We bought, set it up. It worked for 2-4 weeks. And it has not worked since. We called Arlo support. And they determined the battery was defective. They said they would ship a new one. They never did. We called to follow-up, nothing. Called again and were on the phone for a long time, doing all the tasks they told us too. And still no resolution. Only conclusion is to go elsewhere for something similar. Maybe buy the Amazon product.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Bramall Magill

customer_reviews.title: Great system for do it yourselfers
customer_reviews.text: Love our Arlo Pro system. Haven’t had any issue with ours for over a year now. We’ve been impressed with the battery life. They’ll easily last a month with minimal activity, on the flip side it’ll last only a couple weeks in an area with a lot of activity. The app makes controlling the system easy and it’s convenient to operate our home security from our phones.
customer_reviews.author: Mach

customer_reviews.title: Not made to last
customer_reviews.text: I was impressed with the picture quality, ability to record movements and streaming the feed to my phone, however my cameras stopped working in less than a year. Their customer service is awful. I finally was able to get a hold of someone and they sent out one new battery. It worked for a week and then went out again. They told me the batteries on the cameras would last months and mine barely lasted a day. Then both cameras completely stopped working. I had also purchased the Arlo baby camera and it also stopped working after about 6 month. I was a big fan at first but unfortunately can stand behind these products.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy and Affordable!
customer_reviews.text: I started with Arlo buying pieces individually and putting it together and I needed to add one camera outside, so getting this 1 camera pro plus base was very affordable, even more so than buying just the camera. Now I can take my old Arlo and put it outside and use the new one to replace in that room and enjoy audio as well. Have to figure out how to swap out the old base, but Arlo support should have all the answers there!
customer_reviews.author: Timothy D. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup!
customer_reviews.text: It was an easy set up and the video quality is excellent if you sacrifice battery life. I do wish the lens had a wider range but it's pretty good for the price. I've not had them long enough to complete an in depth review. I am having difficulty configuring my cameras with the Samsung SmartThings Hub 3rd Generation. I have not determined whether it's a problem with Samsung or Arlo. So far so good!
customer_reviews.author: Martin S

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely the best
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been in the market for a long time when it came to security cameras, and by far this has been the best choice I’ve ever made. I love the ease and functionality of the cameras and the ability to move and place them as the situation needs without the hassle of wires. The programming is also a plus and love the fact I can set up and program them to my needs. Set up is very easy but can be time consuming in order to meet individual needs. If your in the market for cameras for personal or professional use I would HIGHLY recommend the Arlo cameras
customer_reviews.author: Richard E

customer_reviews.title: Faulty camera, faulty charger, have to pay extra for a camera to detect people?
customer_reviews.text: Slowly one by one each camera is not charging. I have five cameras, a 2nd camera now doesn't recognize/not compatible to original charger. Charger was made with thin longer insert so camera requires specifically arlo charger to fit. Bought these cameras for convenience, but is a headache when they don't charger and become useless. Pic and sound quality below average. Camera only picks up motion about 70% from center on screen. Anything close to edge of screen is not recorded.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: More Hype less developed
customer_reviews.text: I bought this system to be able to keep an eye on the front of my property. The picture quality is dismal, and the motion detection even wise. The settings are an overnight development after thought so don't expect to set recording quality, active zones more complex than a horizontal rectangle plumb only. Its like as user friendly as can be to the extreme... As planned aa can be. Wherever l they've sorry on marketing and modern startup appeal 98% and only 2% on actual development and features. All hype and no guts.
customer_reviews.author: Amzn

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: I have bought 10 of these and 3 of them died in less than 6 month, so it lost around $500. For every 5 camaras you will need a hub and they connects to that hub Wi-Fi not to your existing one so you need to find a good place for the hub or they will produce pure video quality. For the price I was expecting better hardware quality.
customer_reviews.author: M&A Shopping

customer_reviews.title: Battery does not CHARGE!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love the original Arlo server and Arlo cameras with four actual batteries that you replace. I've used Arlo for years and recommended to friends. I purchased the new Arlo server and one new camera (that recharges by cord) less than a month ago and already I am having issues charging the battery. I see on the internet this is a serious flaw in design. I will be returning the server/camera set.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn

customer_reviews.title: Wasn’t to impressed
customer_reviews.text: This will be quick used it for about 3 weeks and these were the reasons I returned it. 1- Every time I checked the Status of the camera ie: battery life, range it was always inaccurate camera died and it showed battery power was full shows I had 2bars connectivity then camera would disconnect. 2- a lot of lag, would start recording when door opened then shows door closing and left out everything in between also catches figure but then stalls and nothing else showing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup/Poor picture Quality
customer_reviews.text: Easy to setup but picture quality isn't that good. Ordered the Arlo Pro 5 camera system and one camera was faulty. Talked to NetGear and they said the same after testing and to return the whole system where I purchased it. Turned out to be a blessing in disguise because for 800 bucks I was expecting a much better picture. I've installed analog camera systems with better picture quality. It looks pretty good on a tiny phone screen, which most do, until you view it on a pc. Then you really see how poor the quality of the picture is. I really wanted this to be as good as it's ratings but it falls very short.
customer_reviews.author: W. T.

customer_reviews.title: Good picture quality but frustrating to deal with
customer_reviews.text: I’m amazed by the picture quality even at night. Audio is really good too BUT it sometimes takes several SEVERAL minutes to connect IF you are able to connect at all.....I’m a couple of weeks in and still extremely frustrated! I’ve had to remove and reinstall the cameras multiple times yet connection is still anyone’s guess. What’s the use of security cameras If you can’t see what’s going on? ‘Customer Service’ is rude and very difficult to understand.
customer_reviews.author: ShoppingMom

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy Arlo products!!!
customer_reviews.text: You can't record and playback or watch a live feed from a local device like most other camera systems do. There is a serious lag time in recording and when using the 2 way audio. There is no actual live feed due to the lag. You have to buy a cloud storage subscription and you can't bypass this. No continuous recording unless you pay an extra $20/month in addition to the minimum of $100/year subscription fee. Arlo cloud constantly goes down for many hours and you won't be notified. I truly regret paying over $1,000 for this p.o.s. system.
customer_reviews.author: phil

customer_reviews.title: The best in its class
customer_reviews.text: Absolute perfection. What else can I say? Please don’t hesitate to buy this product. The negative reviews are bogus! I am a single professional female and was looking for easy setup and operating system. This is exactly it! I absolutely love the product and the peace if mind it gives me. I am very careful about what I buy. I research and read reviews. Sometimes you take a chance, but not with Arlo Pro.
customer_reviews.author: Amavelinga

customer_reviews.title: If you live in Iowa this is not for you!
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 pros and they work great. The Audio is ok, you can hear them, but they can barely hear you when you talk to them. There is also a 3 to 5 second relay, but makes this camera pointless. Sadly, we opened it a few weeks after getting it so the return window closed. We did buy a 3rd camera to try to see if it helps, but not sure if it will. Added a video to show you where the camera started recording a vehicle that showed up in my driveway @2:40am
customer_reviews.author: bryan cutter

customer_reviews.title: Great Wireless Security System
customer_reviews.text: Wanted a wireless system. Read many product reviews. Arlo had the the best ratings. Purchased a six-camera system. It didn't take long to set up/sync/place cameras. The picture is clear. Many schedule options, a sensitivity option, base alarm on or off, and much more. I'm very happy with the purchase and feel that I can watch over my second home without paying exorbitant monthly fees for a security service, or adding a wired service where I'd need an electrician to do an extensive amount of work. I also like that I can move the cameras and/or take the system to another home if I moved and wanted to.
customer_reviews.author: Li88

customer_reviews.title: Not bad. Audio is a nice upgrade. Battery life is so-so
customer_reviews.text: Better than the first gen Arlo but just by a bit. The audio is nice and the rechargeable battery system is a plus. But.... If you don’t have full signal on each camera, that effected cameras battery will drain in about 1.5-2 weeks. That’s a real pain. My first gen Arlo system with the CR123 batteries wasn’t like that. I’d get 3-5 months per battery change. Signal only seemed to effect alarming and live viewing. Battery life was not so much as issue.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Makes a great pet cam!
customer_reviews.text: This is my third arlo camera. I set this one up as an indoor pet came to keep an eye on my dog and cat. I love the microphone and speaker features. I have been calling my dog and the poor guy is so confused, but it's so adorable. The system is so incredibly easy to use. This camera takes a battery but I opted to plug it in, press the sync button, and it was immediately connected to my system. I love the app interface too. It's so clearly laid out and easy to use. This has been a fantastic and fun investment!
customer_reviews.author: Kaytee G.

customer_reviews.title: Misses the important stuff
customer_reviews.text: Motion sensor picks up squirrels and leaves blowing in the mind but did nothing when someone got in my car and drove off. Thankfully it was someone I knew that I lent my car too but I was shocked that Arlo didn't record it or at least create a motion detection alert. I'd return this if I could but it took 3 months to fail. When I installed it it recorded getting in and out of my car and especially when it moved. Now all I get is squirrels, moths and leaves.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Arlo not working.
customer_reviews.text: We purchased the Arlo through Amazon in Dec of 2018. We got it for our summer home to watch the wild life. We did use it a little this winter just to see how it would work. Well all was great till we moved to our summer home. Now it will not take a charge or record at night. Just seems weird that all of a sudden all these issues come up. I’m hoping someone can help me. I really don’t want to lose all the money I invested in it. It’s not even a year old. Please help. Thank you Sherry.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Security Made Simple!!!
customer_reviews.text: Oh my goodness, this is a fantastic system. I had it hooked up and working within 30 minutes and it probably could have been quicker. The only tool needed was a screwdriver to put up the magnet that holds the camera. :) Simple!!!! I've looked at security systems for several years but never got one .... SOOOOOO glad I waited! This is AWESOME! I plan to add one more camera. I have already bought a second system for our business and a third system for my daughter's home.
customer_reviews.author: Georgia

customer_reviews.title: Still needs some work
customer_reviews.text: Overall I like the quality of the camera and ease of installation. However, the app is a bit awkward and geofencing sometimes does not work. I also don't like that you cannot connect the camera to the wifi network, only to the base station. If you are out of range of the base station, there is no way to use the camera. The Arlo Q does not work with the pro base station either so there is no alternative other than getting another base station that needs to be managed separately. I'm on the fence for either a 3 or 4 star rating but it just slipped into the 4 range.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: For the price it's a good video surveillance option
customer_reviews.text: For the price it's a good video surveillance option. It does have some flaws. It's about 3-5 seconds delayed to real time. Facial features are not easily identifiable a little pixelated. But free cloud storage for 7days is really nice. And you can have multiples. Picks up audio very well and has a decent speaker for talking with others. Having one by your front door is it good start but it would really benefit you to set up other angles in case your one camera misses something. Update over a year later, it still has it's quirks but not bad. Would really like to see a quicker response and better image quality. But overall it gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Allen

customer_reviews.title: Good cameras, bad mounts included for outdoor use, no Google Home integration
customer_reviews.text: The cameras seem to work well and provide sufficiently clear images. The motion detection also seems to work well. The Android app is a bit confusing, but usable. I have three main complaints about the product: First, the packaging is ridiculous for the 5-camera kit; taking apart the plastic dome that encloses the cameras is like solving a puzzle. Second, four of the five enclosed camera mounts are of the magnetic variety, which according to the Netgear website, are for *indoor* use only; why sell weather-proof cameras with indoor-only mounts? Finally, Netgear apparently refuses to provide Google Home integration, for reasons they won't explain on their forum; thinking about returning the whole $800+ package because of this.
customer_reviews.author: SmartBean

customer_reviews.title: Lots of hype. Not worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: The camera is 20 ft from the base. Worked great for 2 days. But for the past week can’t play back the clip. It takes forever to load and then will only play 10-12 sec of the clip and will get the rotating wheel for ever. Have other cameras on other properties that work MUCH better and far more reliable. I threw away the box, other wise I’d return it. Very disappointed. Good idea, poor performance!
customer_reviews.author: M. Ozeri

customer_reviews.title: buy something else
customer_reviews.text: absolutely piece of crap. I don't know why it's getting so many good reviews. Probably people have never see what a good security camera system should be. This is just a poorly designed toy. To list a few flaws: 1. the kit includes screws for install, when I try to use a drill on these screws, the thread goes out immediately. for a 200+ dollar kit, they cut corner on screws. 2. the delay from the camera to the app is definitely more than 3seconds, not sure how they manage that in 2019. remarkable. 3. the pair process for base station and phone app takes minutes. Its 2019!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: POS, dont buy.
customer_reviews.text: After o e year the camera has basicly just given up. With motion dection set on high it still records after the person walk away and I never see who it was. Most of the time the camera will not record anything all day even though six or seven people came buy to see my mom.. this was an extreem whaste of money buying this camera and i should gave just bought a quality trail camera. Not to mention the cost of new batteries are ridiculous.
customer_reviews.author: The Lyttle Yellow House
